title: MongoDB Replication
subject: MongoDB
theory: Replication provides high availability and redundancy. A replica set contains one Primary node (accepts writes) and multiple Secondaries (replicate data via Oplog). If primary fails, an election promotes a secondary.

examples.explanation: Adding a new member to an existing replica set.

common_mistakes.correction: Secondaries are Read-Only by default. You can enable 'slaveOk' (legacy) or Read Preference, but never writes.

interview_questions.question: What is the Oplog?
interview_questions.answer: Operations Log. A capped collection that keeps a rolling record of all operations that modify the data, used for replication.

real_world_use_cases.description: Keeping a secondary in a different AWS region.

summary: Replication is mandatory for production systems to survive server failures.
